data.title: Eden Index for Woodburn, Kentucky
data.meta_description: Compare scores for climate health, recreational opportunities, and natural disaster risk for Woodburn compiled into our curated Eden Index.
data.text:
Woodburn, Kentucky is a small rural community situated in Warren County. The town experiences a humid subtropical climate, characterized by hot and humid summers, mild winters, and abundant rainfall throughout the year. Average temperatures range from the low 30s째F (-1째C) in winter to the mid-80s째F (29째C) in summer.

Located near the Barren River, Woodburn benefits from its close proximity to water resources. The river, along with several creeks and ponds, contributes to the hydrology constituents of the area, providing opportunities for fishing, boating, and other water-based activities. The Barren River Lake State Resort Park, just a short drive away, offers additional outdoor recreation opportunities such as camping, hiking, and swimming.

For nature enthusiasts, Woodburn is surrounded by picturesque landscapes, including rolling hills, lush forests, and picturesque farmland. These scenic areas invite visitors to explore the great outdoors through activities like birdwatching, hiking, and photography. The town's tranquil and natural surroundings make it an ideal destination for those seeking a peaceful retreat while immersing themselves in nature's beauty.

In summary, Woodburn, Kentucky offers a humid subtropical climate, rich hydrology constituents from the Barren River, and various outdoor recreation opportunities that cater to nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts.
